world.physics.collision

Class Collision

  • java.lang.Object
    • world.physics.collision.Collision
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BorderCollision, EntityCollision

    public abstract class Collision
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class describing the properties of collisions.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Tom Sydney Kerckhove & Xavier Goas Aguililla

      • getCollisionPosition

        public Position getCollisionPosition()
        Returns the collision position.
        Returns:
        The position at which two entities will collide.

      • canHaveAsPosition

        public boolean canHaveAsPosition(Position position)
        Checks if the given position is a valid position for this collision.
        Parameters:
        position - The given position
        Returns:
        Whether this position is not null and within the world. | position != null && world.isInWorld(position)

      • getWorld

        public World getWorld()
        A getter for the world in which the collision occurs.
        Returns:
        The world to which this position belongs.

      • canHaveAsWorld

        @Basic
@Raw
public boolean canHaveAsWorld(World world)
        Checks whether this collision can have the given world as its world.
        Parameters:
        world - The world to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given world is not null. | result = (world!=null)

      • setWorld

        A setter for the world in which the collision occurs.
        Parameters:
        world - The given world.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given world is not a valid world. | !canHaveAsWorld(world)

      • getTimeToCollision

        public double getTimeToCollision()
        Returns the time of collision.

      • getNextCollision

        public static Collision getNextCollision(World world)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the next collision to happen in the given world.
        Parameters:
        world - The given world.
        Returns:
        The next collision to happen in the given world. | for each collision | for each other collision | calculate collision time | if (this collision time < smallest collision time) | smallest collision time = this collision time | return smallest collision time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given world is null. | world == null
